visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts Stock Chart with the following specifications: Chart type: Stock Chart, Chart title: 'AAPL Stock Prices', Axes and labels styling: Use a dark background with white text for labels and titles, Data series: Fetch data from 'https://demo-live-data.highcharts.com/aapl-c.json' for the series, Custom colors: Use a gradient from blue to green for the series, Additional configurations: Enable x-axis zooming, add annotations for min, max, and average values, and style the annotations with specific labels and formats.

points: annotation => { getMinMax(annotation.chart); return { x: annotation.chart.xAxis[0].min, xAxis: 0, y: (minMax.yMin + minMax.yMax) / 2, yAxis: 0 }; }
annotation => ({ x: annotation.chart.xAxis[0].max, xAxis: 0, y: (minMax.yMin + minMax.yMax) / 2, yAxis: 0 })

labels.point: () => ({ x: minMax.xMax, xAxis: 0, y: minMax.yMax, yAxis: 0 })
() => ({ x: minMax.xMin, xAxis: 0, y: minMax.yMin, yAxis: 0 })
annotation => ({ x: annotation.chart.xAxis[0].min + 10e7, xAxis: 0, y: (minMax.yMin + minMax.yMax) / 2, yAxis: 0 })

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts Stock Chart configuration is designed to visualize AAPL stock prices fetched from a live data source. The chart features a dark background with white text for labels and titles, enhancing readability. The x-axis is of type 'datetime' to represent time series data, and zooming is enabled specifically for the x-axis. Annotations are added to highlight the minimum, maximum, and average values, with labels formatted to display two decimal places. The series data is styled with a gradient from blue to green, providing a visually appealing representation of the stock price fluctuations. Overall, this configuration ensures a comprehensive and aesthetically pleasing visualization of stock data.
